name: The JPF team
description: JPF is a Java VM used to verify and debug software

projects.summary: Enhancing jpf-core to support Java 11 and 17 features, ensuring that advanced bootstrap methods are interpreted correctly on JPF.
Identifying and implementing support for new Java 17 features in JPF which are currently unsupported, including records and sealed classes.
Improve SPF integration with string constraint solvers and enhance existing capabilities to better handle string analysis.
Implement support for runtime exceptions in certain functions within SPF, and improve SPF's compatibility with Java 11.

projects.project_name: Support Portfolio of Solvers in SPF
projects.summary: Enable the concurrent use of multiple solvers in SPF, improving the efficiency of handling complex constraints.

projects.project_name: Use LLM to Generate Sound Reduction Rules in SPF
projects.summary: Leverage Large Language Models to derive reduction rules for constraints in SPF, optimizing solver performance.

GSoC 2025 Project Ideas
=======================

[Jump to bottom](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#wiki-pages-box)

Soha Hussein edited this page Feb 20, 2025 · [11 revisions](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas/_history)

Project Ideas
=============

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#project-ideas)

Please note that this list is not exclusive. If you have other ideas and topics related to JPF, please let us know on the [JPF Google group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/java-pathfinder). A possible proposal template can be found at the bottom of our GSoC page: [JPF Google Summer of Code 2025](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/JPF-Google-Summer-of-Code-2025).

### JPF Infrastructure

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#jpf-infrastructure)

*   ![Image 13: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) [Support Java 11/17 for JPF extensions](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#support-java-11)
    
*   ![Image 14: #FFD700](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ff7ab78d152ae181835351027e8eb4fc2a6f269be4b78c107b8cac5296229c1c/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f4646443730302f4646443730302e706e67) [Support Java 17 for jpf-core](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#support-java-17)
    

### Symbolic Pathfinder (SPF)

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#symbolic-pathfinder-spf)

*   ![Image 15: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) [String Constraint Solver Integration in SPF](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#improving-string-analysis-in-spf)
    
*   ![Image 16: #FFD700](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ff7ab78d152ae181835351027e8eb4fc2a6f269be4b78c107b8cac5296229c1c/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f4646443730302f4646443730302e706e67) [Support runtime exceptions in SPF](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#runtime-exception-in-spf)
    
*   ![Image 17: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) [Support a portfolio of solvers in SPF](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#solvers-portfolio-in-spf)
    
*   ![Image 18: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) [Use LLM to generate sound reduction rules in SPF](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#llm-reduction-rules-in-spf)
    

### Environment and Test Case Generation

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#environment-and-test-case-generation)

### Project Description

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#project-description)

#### ![Image 19: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) Support Java 11/17 for JPF extensions

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-support-java-1117-for-jpf-extensions)

**Description:** jpf-core is essentially a JVM that currently fully supports only Java 8 and Java 11 (with limitations on bootstrap methods). Bootstrap methods are currently interpreted, which works for common usage but may not work for advanced cases. The goal of this project is to generate the call site code on the fly so bootstrap methods work as on the host JVM.

**Difficulty:** Hard  
**Scope:** 350 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Java bytecode  
**Preferred skills:** Knowledge of private Java APIs **Possible Mentors:** Cyrille

#### ![Image 20: #FFD700](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ff7ab78d152ae181835351027e8eb4fc2a6f269be4b78c107b8cac5296229c1c/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f4646443730302f4646443730302e706e67) Support for Java 17 for jpf-core

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-support-for-java-17-for-jpf-core)

Related to the project above, there are also some new features in Java 17 that are not yet supported by JPF. We have work in progress on branch `java-17`. Currently unsupported Java features include language features that are not supported at run time (e.g., records) and Java language features that are not fully analyzed (e.g., sealed classes). In this project, you would identify such unsupported features and extend JPF (jpf-core) to support them.

**Difficulty:** Medium  
**Scope:** 175 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Java internals  
**Possible Mentors:** Cyrille

#### ![Image 21: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) Robustify String solving for SPF

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-robustify-string-solving-for-spf)

**Description:** The goal of this project is to test SPF integration with Z3 string constraint solving; adding support cvc5 is a plus.

**Difficulty:** Hard  
**Scope:** 350 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Symbolic Pathfinder  
**Preferred skills:** Knowledge of String constraint solving.  
**Possible Mentors:** Corina, Elena, Soha

#### ![Image 22: #FFD700](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/ff7ab78d152ae181835351027e8eb4fc2a6f269be4b78c107b8cac5296229c1c/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f4646443730302f4646443730302e706e67) Support runtime exception in SPF

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-support-runtime-exception-in-spf)

**Description:** The main goal of this project is to support throwing a runtime exception for some of the summarized functions such as `String.substring`. Also, this project should build on [SPF](https://github.com/SymbolicPathFinder/jpf-symbc) Java 11 Gradle support, which implies fixing existing issues.

**Difficulty:** Meduim  
**Scope:** 175 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Symbolic Pathfinder  
**Possible Mentors:** Soha

#### ![Image 23: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) Support portfolio of solvers in SPF

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-support-portfolio-of-solvers-in-spf)

**Description:** The main goal of this project is to enable the simultaneous invocation of multiple solvers, terminating the wait as soon as any solver returns a satisfiable result. This approach is expected to enhance [SPF's](https://github.com/SymbolicPathFinder/jpf-symbc) ability to handle a broader range of constraints.

**Difficulty:** Hard  
**Scope:** 350 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Symbolic Pathfinder  
**Preferred skills:** Expeirence with various solvers  
**Possible Mentors:** Soha

#### ![Image 24: #f03c15](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d92ac173fd3b6a2ad026b4ecba52b120aed4d67fcf0a5e8a1102a3cf1de9d87d/68747470733a2f2f706c616365686f6c642e636f2f31357831352f6630336331352f6630336331352e706e67) Use LLM to generate sound reduction rules in SPF

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#-use-llm-to-generate-sound-reduction-rules-in-spf)

**Description:** Solver constraints can become very complex, and very large. In this project, we will use LLM in [SPF](https://github.com/SymbolicPathFinder/jpf-symbc) to identify sound reduction rules that can be applied to the constraints before sending them to the solver, ideally improving its performance. See [this paper](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-642-39176-7_19) for reference.

**Difficulty:** Hard  
**Scope:** 350 hours  
**Required skills:** Knowledge of Symbolic Pathfinder  
**Preferred skills:** LLM  
**Possible Mentors:** Soha

### Want to contribute to this Wiki?

[](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-core/wiki/GSoC-2025-Project-Ideas#want-to-contribute-to-this-wiki)

Please contact us by creating an issue. We are trying to fix the process below, which no longer works.

[Fork it and send a pull request.](https://github.com/javapathfinder/jpf-wiki-sync)
